SEARCH
Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class ReliabilityAnalysis

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.ReliabilityAnalysis
public class ReliabilityAnalysis extends Object
ReliabilityAnalysis analyzes the end-to-end reliability of messages transmitted in flows for the WARP system.

Let M represent the Minimum Packet Reception Rate on an edge in a flow. The end-to-end reliability for each flow, flow:src->sink, is computed iteratively as follows:
(1)The flow:src node has an initial probability of 1.0 when it is released. All other initial probabilities are 0.0. (That is, the reset of the nodes in the flow have an initial probability value of 0.0.)
(2) each src->sink pair probability is computed as NewSinkNodeState = (1-M)*PrevSnkNodeState + M*PrevSrcNodeState
This value represents the probability that the message as been received by the node SinkNode. Thus, the NewSinkNodeState probability will increase each time a push or pull is executed with SinkNode as a listener.

The last probability state value for any node is the reliability of the message reaching that node, and the end-to-end reliability of a flow is the value of the last Flow:SinkNode probability.

CS2820 Fall 2024 Project: Implement this class to compute the probabilities that comprise the ReliablityMatrix, which is the core of the reliability visualization that is requested in Warp.

To do this, you will need to retrieve the program source, parse the instructions for each node, in each time slot, to extract the src and snk nodes in the instruction and then apply the message success probability equation defined in the project assignment.

I recommend using the getInstructionParameters method of the WarpDSL class to extract the src and snk nodes from the instruction string in a program schedule time slot.

Version:
1.8 Fall 2024
Author:
sgoddard

      Parameters:
      prevReliabilityRow - an ArrayList of doubles
      nNodesInFlow - a int value that relates the number of the nodes in the flow
      M - the minimum packet reception rate
      minLinkReliabilityNeeded - a double that is the min reliability per link to hit E2E
      nPushes - a ArrayList of integers of pushes
      Returns:
      currentReliabilityRow a ArrayList of doubles reps reliability states of each node at

    • calculateNextSinkState

      private Double calculateNextSinkState(Double M, Double prevSnkNodeState, Double prevSrcNodeState, Double minLinkReliabilityNeeded)
      Calculates the new reliability state for a sink node based on M,prevSnkNodeState, prevSrcNodeState, minLinkReliabilityNeeded
      Parameters:
      M - the minimum packet reception rate
      prevSnkNodeState - a double that represents the previous sink node state
      prevSrcNodeState - a double that represents the previous source node state
      minLinkReliabilityNeeded - a double that is the minimum reliability needed per link in a flow to hit E2E
      Returns:
      returns the next reliability state
